abstract: Laurence D. Fink, chief executive of BlackRock, stands alone among the biggest money market fund providers in opposing a proposed safety net for the $3 trillion industry.
snippet: Laurence D. Fink, chief executive of BlackRock, stands alone among the biggest money market fund providers in opposing a proposed safety net for the $3 trillion industry.
lead_paragraph: 1:44 p.m. | Updated BlackRock opposes part of a proposed safety net for the money market fund industry, although it supports efforts to provide liquidity during times of “severe market conditions,” according to a statement sent to DealBook by a spokeswoman for the firm.

headline.main: BlackRock Opposes Spreading Money Fund Risks
